caption: The exhibition itself was excellent, but the service quality at the inquiry and checkout counters was inconsistent. I encountered very professional and friendly staff, but some employees were too busy chatting during work hours, completely ignoring customers. Since I am not fluent in French, I strongly felt the impatience of the cashier, which was very disappointing. I hope the management will address this issue to ensure that all visitors receive the respect and good service they deserve.

Highly recommend to visit this masterpiece of architecture with its garden of biodiversity. The exhibition that is currently going on is fantastic and inspiring too. Fabric works from Colombian artisit. Usually would have its tickets sold out if you walk in so better just reserve it a day earlier or more

Although the Cartier foundation currently only hosts long-term temporary exhibitions and does not have a permanent collection, the quality of these exhibitions and the architecture of the building make it a worthwhile visit, regardless of the artist. I visited during Olga de Amaral’s first major European retrospective and I was amazed by the quality of her work, the sheer size of the space and design which made the art shine. Would recommend, especially if you can time the entrance with a guided tour.

Amazing. I visited the Olga de Amaral exhibition here. It was fantastic. Different spaces, excellent organization,  professional guide, charming security. The only one remarque, the toilet could be cleaner

A compact but very impressive museum conveniently outside the city center. I liked the current exhibition a lot, and the infographics were very comprehensive. The flyers helped to follow the exhibition even better. The artworks are very worth seeing and display great craftmanship.  The building is very suitable for showcasing modern art, and the glass walls create a harmonious athmosphere.  I visited the museum during a weekday evening, and it required no queueing to get in. A nice art experience that is of optimal size to be enjoyed at once.
The visit to the Olga de Amaral exhibition was great, the guided tour was magical, you immerse yourself in the roots of the artist and his works. The exterior is very nice too.
Visited the space for an exhibition held by Olga de Amaral. Incredible space and felt so unique! Definitely recommend going after sunset to see more perspectives from the reflections!
We visited Olga de Amaral’s exhibition yesterday and we were mesmerized by her unique artwork. What a sight to see!
Super beautiful museum and exhibition, definitely worth a visit!
The  museum in itself is already beautiful but  the Olga de Amaral exhibition is so amazing.

The Fondation Cartier is, of course, an architectural gem on its own, and the Olga de Amaral exhibition is truly a marvel! Her work is captivating and deserves to be experienced fully. The only downside was that it was quite busy during our visit, which made it a bit challenging to fully immerse ourselves in her world. I’d recommend opting for an early morning time slot to enjoy the exhibition more peacefully.
Beautiful exhibition by wonderful Colombian artist Olga de Amaral
Wonderful exhibition at a very well maintained exhibition space

Contemporary art will always be an acquired taste for me. The current exhibition featuring an American athlete turned sculptor has a great narrative especially in explaining the tension points between developing muscles and letting someone’s creativity manifest.  However… while the clay exhibits were impressive, some areas I found underwhelming. For example, the ground floor had smeared mud on them which I get were symbolic but I couldn’t find more depth beyond my visual interpretation. Again, subjective. The sensorial recorded performance was haunting but also a slow burn.  Anyway, the staff from the ticket booth all the way to the exhibit guides were really nice and accommodating.

What an absolutely amazing building!  We were lucky enough to be there to see the Rothko show and the entire experience was magical! The building is incredible - if you are there be sure to check out the stairwells so you can see all of the maquettes and mini displays about the building and Gehry and the design. Great location, the walk is a bit long when it's freezing out (ok, Paris in January, I know) from the metro station but totally worth it.  I'm sure in the summer it's the perfect lazy stroll through the Bois to get to the museum...
Amazing exhibition but most of all the staff was so so nice, friendly and knowledgable that this was certainly the climax of our visit to Paris! Thank you so much for that wonderful afternoon.

What's a nice discovery. The light enters from the huge walls made in glass. The art pieces exposed reflet thier image and colors making the visit even more interesting. I will go back there again in the spring or summer time to check out the 'secret' garden they have behind the scene.
Great exhibition of Olga de Amara l

The building is a striking glass construction with a peaceful, green garden behind. The price is perhaps a bit steep for quite small exhibitions, but it's an interesting visit on a whim if you fancy something different from the mainstream cultural offerings in the city.

This is an interesting museum a little away from the tourist hotspots in Paris. It's housed in a straight forward building with glass around and with a garden around at the back.  In the garden you can enjoy a drink in the shade. In front is a busy street.  It's a museum for modern or contemporary art with interesting exhibitions. There is a small bookshop with art books

The museum building is a nice cultural space and the surrounding garden is a stunning green oasis in the area. Ron Mueck's exhibition is not leaving you unaffected. His unique vision and expression of the world around us are remarkable.

Photography exhibition of a Mexican woman Graciela Iturbide. The building itself is modern, functional, the exhibit is well lighted with few problems if you want to take a pic some "reflection". The pictures were chronological from 60ties to last 2000, and mostly B&W, portraits to more geometrical. The photographer wasn't well known in France & most pics were never shown. All in all worth to see. There a nice garden in the back of the building, left wild & you can have a drink, in this quiet relaxing place.

🎨 Cartier Foundation is a contemporary art museum that was founded in 1984 by the jewelry company Cartier. It is located in a glass and steel building designed by Jean Nouvel, which blends with the surrounding garden created by Lothar Baumgarten. It hosts temporary exhibitions of various artists from different disciplines and backgrounds.  👍 I recommend this place, which is very creative and original. The exhibitions are usually pretty great and show different perspectives and expressions of contemporary art. The entrance fee is good, but even better if you pay the annual subscription (it's kind of the same price as two tickets). You can also enjoy the garden, which is a peaceful oasis in the city.  🌟 I give 5 stars to this place, which is a nice and inspiring place to visit. It also has a bookstore, a café and a cinema that offer more cultural activities. It is a great place for art lovers and curious minds.
Amazing cultural space, always great experience ❤️ thanks a lot

This is a small space and, regardless of the exhibition, it will be a quick tour in your schedule. But that doesn't mean it's an expendable program! In addition to the smart architecture (which respected the land nature and integrated trees and walls), there is a garden design with numerous rare trees. The art curation, not is also impressive. It's really worth it!

This place is awesome I m a tattoo artist by profession and I ended up going here for so many beautiful references of skull and amazing sculpture’s really beautiful space in the back to just relax and also has alot of beautiful plates and flowers .  Make sure to visit this place if u  r in Paris :)  not many people when I left which allowed me to take awesome pictures :) please  follow my instagram pages @think_before_u_ink @onee.yedview .

Beautiful gardens, but they were setting up a concert for the following day so not that peaceful. The gallery is nice, but there is only one temporary exhibition showing. The building is filled with offices mainly. Disappointed as I thought I would have seen more for the entrance price.
Small scale museum with good outdoor view space. 2 ground floor spaces divided by the central bookstore area on the 1st floor. There is also the underground area.
A beautiful exhibition of Olga de Amaral's creation

Very modern architecture among the Hausmann style. Fully built with glass.  The exhibition is excellent even though I’d like to understand more. Because the art collection this period is way to abstract.  The building is huge however the exhibition is limited. I wish I can see something more. The ticket is not so cheap so I expect something more. Since I have seen to the Cartier foundation in Shanghai which is absolutely beyond amazing, the one in Paris shouldn’t be inferior.

I loved loved this exhibitions. If you have time for only one exhibitions go to the foundation Cartier to enjoy Fabrice Hyber, a very authentic, original, stimulating artist. The building is very nice too, surrounded by a garden. They usually have small, interesting exhibitions. No restaurant or coffee shop. A book shop.

Went here for Damien Hirst's cherry blossom exhibition. The exhibition was hosted on two floors, the staff was very friendly and cordial. They provided you with a pamphlet (available in both English and French) describing the exhibition and the artist and his thoughts and methods behind the paintings along with markings on the map naming the paintings. You could also access a small bookshop on the first floor having a good collection of art and photography related books among others. The best part for me is that they provide free entry for students after 6pm on Tuesdays! (You still need to reserve a slot from their website, they have a separate category for this) Looking forward to going for the upcoming exhibitions:)  Update: also went for tje Sally Gabori exhibition in September 2022, loved it too. Beautifully curated!! The colours were so bold and vivid and the story of the artist inspiring!
Great space and fresh exhibits

The current exhibition is by Olga de Amaral from Colombia who works with textiles. She weaves them in different patterns. She combines patches of material, as in a quilt, but creates a forest kind of effect due to differing colors and shear size of the object. Many things she has done are well worth seeing.

Even though my ticket was for 11 am, I had to stay in a waiting line for 30 minutes outside... they were not ready to check visitors covid's statue! Huge and expensive bùilding. Only 4 rooms for exposition. The oral presentation of 12 o'clock was done by a young person giving an impression of an internship student.... not knowing how to speak about art... all this giving a bad impression. Such a misery!

Beautiful exhibition of Latin American artists involving geometric designs. Nice building architecture itself, with different layouts in the ground floor and in the basement. The lighting in art pieces is well placed, often creating stronger contrast on the piece. The garden behind the building is cozy, great to chill in the afternoon.

Loved Damien Hirst's Cherry Blossom exhibition! These paintings are just wonderful and it's impressive to think this is just the tip of the iceberg as a few 70 canvas remain with the artist. I even bought a poster so that I can frame it. Definitely recommend it!
Quite disappointed for what it offered for 11€. The exhibition, which was across 3 medium sized rooms, was truly boring and only 4 intresting paintings stood out for me.
